messages.title: NHS Chief rebukes Labour’s Joan Ryan for misleading residents on Chase Farm
messages.content: The Chief Executive of NHS Enfield has called out Enfield North Labour MP Joan Ryan for her recent letter and leaflet to residents saying there would be a '24-hour local A&E' at Chase Farm.

messages.title: NHS Chief slams Labour’s dishonesty on Chase Farm
messages.content: But in an appalling act of spin, Labour are continuing to call the urgent care centre '24-hour local A&E'.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Halt Labour’s cuts to Chase Farm Hospital
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservatives will halt the cuts to Chase Farm Hospital, including the closure of its 24-hour A&E department after 2013.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Let local GPs decide what’s best for Chase Farm
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservatives plan to halt Labour’s plans for cuts to London hospitals, making decisions on Chase Farm’s future subject to the choice of patients and their local GPs – not politicians.
The Conservatives are the only party committed to protecting health spending in real terms, year on year for 5 years - we will not make the sick pay for Labour’s Debt Crisis.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Enfield North is a marginal constituency - only the Conservatives can beat Labour here. Your vote really matters.

issues.health: The Conservatives are the only party committed to protecting health spending in real terms, year on year for 5 years - we will not make the sick pay for Labour’s Debt Crisis.

housing.content: The Conservatives will halt the cuts to Chase Farm Hospital, including the closure of its 24-hour A&E department after 2013.

images.caption: Promoted by Tom Waterhouse on behalf of Enfield North Conservatives, both of 276 Baker Street, Enfield, EN1 3LD.
